intro: Isoglossa bracteosa, commonly known as the bracted isoglossa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a bluish-green hue. Isoglossa bracteosa typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along streambanks.
